data.title: Accepting completion from IntelliSense now selects the part that got completed

data.title: Add "select all matches" command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Similar to Sublime Text `cmd+ctrl+g` command which selects all the matches of current selection 

http://gfycat.com/DazzlingMeagerErin

data.title: .ts and .d.ts files sharing the same filename interfere with each other

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have an in-house library written in TypeScript. It consists of two files: `promises.ts` and a `promises.d.ts` exposing related interfaces globally. The TypeScript compiler has no problem with this setup, and neither does IntelliJ, but VSCode seems to only "be aware" of the `promises.d.ts` content while I have it open as the active file. As soon as I close it or switch to another file, the interfaces declared in `promises.d.ts` get flagged as unknown.
I have seen this on two different computers running VSCode. Both VSCode installations are currenty up to date. It also happens with other libraries using the same naming pattern.
We are not using TypeScript's "generate declaration files" setting.

data.title: vscode should have its own orgnization on github.
data.body: As more extensions  added to vscode, it is reasonable that all the vscode related stuff goes to one place that allow people to easily work with it.

data.title: [js] Parameters of ArrowFunction in JavaScript, does not get syntax hightlighted

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`var a = function (value) { }`  this code highlights the parameter value 
`var a = (value) => { }` but this one does not. 

this also happens in TypeScript.  is this intended?

data.title: [editorconfig] Use tab_width instead of indent_size

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If `indent_style` is set to tab on editorconfig, the proper value to use in setting indentation size is `tab_width`, as per the [EditorConfig specifications](http://editorconfig.org/):

> For example, tab_width need not be specified unless it differs from the value of indent_size. Also, when indent_style is set to "tab", it may be desirable to leave indent_size unspecified so readers may view the file using their preferred indentation format.

data.title: Add more keyboard bindings for debug features

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Add more keyboard bindings for debug features such as Add watch and evaluate in console.

data.title: Allow variables in launch.json config
data.body:
Allowing a variable like '${file}', in "launch.json" would open up nice workflows.

For example, I want to launch the debugger with the current file as a parameter, so that I can run a specific test.

Right now, I need to modify the launch.config every time I want to debug a single test.

data.title: output console not showing process.stdout.write

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**I have this on my tasks.json**

{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd",
    "options": {
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development"
      }
    },
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["/C"],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "Run node current file",
            "args": ["node ", "${file}"],
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "suppressTaskName": true
        }
    ]
}

**when running this script using the node task:**

'use strict'

var os = require('os')
var eol = os.EOL
var nl = 'hola \r\n'

console.log(os.uptime() + nl)
console.log(os.type())
console.log('h', eol)
console.log(eol)
process.stdout.write('hello: x')

**the output is:**

185583.3875537hola 
Windows_NT
h 

**but on the console running node filename.js**

185603.0488328hola

Windows_NT
h

hello: x

data.title: debugging bluebird promises
data.body:
Can vscode debug node code allowing one to step through promises without setting breakpoints? This is similar to clicking "Async" in the chome debug tools as described in this question.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32767721/how-to-step-through-debugger-with-promises

data.title: Double-clicking leading whitespace should select all leading whitespace
data.body:
In most editors, you can double-click anywhere in the leading whitespace of a line to select all such leading whitespace (even mixed tab/space).

In VS Code, double-clicking leading whitespace only selects that single whitespace character.

Examples of expected behavior in Notepad++ and VS, and unexpected behavior in Code:

![leadingwhitespace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5943573/11728708/256edbe2-9f40-11e5-9d99-6083e65eb1e5.gif)

data.title: Support JSON Schema for YAML files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It's getting more common to use YAML for configuration. For example `docker-compose.yml` or Swagger files are usually written in YAML. The JSON Schema based autocomplete for JSON files is a neat feature, please enable that for YAML files also.

data.title: [python] strings in dictionary values incorrectly highlighted
data.body:
When creating dictionaries with any values the strings in the value section are all hi-lighted blue and not red. 
e.g. for the following code snippet

``` python
{"a":{"b":"c"}}
```

The string "a" will be highlighted red, while "b" and "c" will be highlighted blue even though they are both strings like "a" is.  "b" is also a key to a dict like "a" is 

Note: this is using the "Light" theme

data.title: [js] Quotes not parsed properly in ES6 string templates

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using single or double quotes within back-tick quotes, they are not considered quoted:

![screenshot 2015-12-10 14 26 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/573056/11725918/1e339a48-9f4a-11e5-90ac-d02f433dcdca.png)

So if they happen to be closed within the back ticks, it's not the end of the world, but if not, all subsequent formatting is lost.

data.title: Question: Is there a cli for this?
data.body:
I wanted to use https://www.npmjs.com/package/open in my extension. 

Is there a way, from VS Code `F1` (or the cmd line) to install open, grab the d.ts from nuget (unpackage it to the correct subdir), add the `/// ref` to the current ts and update the package.json?

Thank you

data.title: "Change all Occurrences" in a string with stop or whitespace chars
data.body: "Change all Occurrences" doesn't work if the text selection contains stops, spaces or such. Furthermore, if the text was selected from L->R - it just doesn't do anything, but if R->L - it automatically selects the most left word and then invokes the "Change all Occurrences".

data.title: Joh/diag source
data.body: Add source to diagnostic object such that user can tell what linter/language service/extension created what error, See #1010

data.title: Allow relative path when adding file to project folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Similar like Atom does it when adding a file to a project folder, allow us to specify a path relative to the project folder.

This would be a much more convenient way to add files compared to navigating a file tree and clicking buttons, especially useful for those of us who like to disable trackpads on their laptops and use keyboard only.

Say I have in my project folder the subfolder 'foo', and inside 'foo' I have 'bar', allow me to create a new file directly giving this:

foo/bar/newfile.ts

Ideally, we would have autocompletion using [tab] for folder names, and it would create subfolders if needed, e.g. this

foo/bar/newfolder/newfile.ts

would also create 'newfolder'.

data.title: Can't write Vietnamese text in editor with UniKey software
data.body: this not for vietnamese programer ? i can not write vietnamese language: "Tôi yêu Việt Nam" on editor, please fix !

data.title: Allow multiple build tasks depending on file type

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm working with a lot of projects that have different build tasks for different file types, for example I `javac` for Java, `pdflatex` for Latex, others may have `lessc` for their styles and `babel` for their JS.
Currently, you can only define _one_ build task to be run when Ctrl+Shift+B is pressed. tasks.json allows us to nicely define tasks to run with the currently opened file, but (eg compile the currently open java / Latex / Less / ES6 file), but you can only assign one of these tasks the shortcut that comes with `isBuildCommand`.

It would be nice if instead of just `"isBuildCommand": true` we could also define `"isBuildCommand": "java"` and for another task `"isBuildCommand": "latex"` so VS Code automatically runs the desired task when pressing Ctrl+Shift+B depending on what type of file is currently open.

This should also work with `"isTestCommand"`

data.title: Feature request : add file location and line number to CompletionItem

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hello,

I've read this new feature will be available soon:
With the Dec15 update you can invoke this command https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/common/extHostLanguageFeatureCommands.ts#L55 to retrieve the same list of completions the UI would show.

It would be great to know where the CompletionItem is pointing to (which file and which line number) if available locally of course.
This could help extensions to display a function, or to go to that function, or to analyse the function to add more info for example when available ...

It could apply to provideHover, so when the text is hovered one can add info regarding the function pointed with an extension.

I hope this could help others.

data.title: Joh/commands as api
data.body: Will address #913 by giving you a way to document commands in line

data.title: Feature Request: Debugging of AngularJS projects
data.body: I don't know if this is possible or am asking for too much, but is it possible to have the debugger debug angularjs? I am talking of the same debugging experience as the one I get when using it to debug nodejs

data.title: Document Range Formatting fails
data.body:
Steps:
- extension that registers a document and a document range formatting provider
- open a test workspace that activates the extension and trigger a range format.

You get:

```
i.formatRange is not a function: TypeError: i.formatRange is not a function
    at Object.u [as formatRange] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1579:7171)
    at t.run (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1579:12653)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1598:17974
    at __dirname.undefined.t.Class.define.then (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1544:7415)
    at e.showContextMenu (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1598:17232)
    at e._doShowContextMenu (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Visual Studio Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:1578:25279)
```

data.title: Workspace UI storage not picked up when launching workspace with different casing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently we loose all workspace associated state when the workspace path is using different casing. Ideally the storage is agnostic to casing for file systems that are case insensitive.

data.title: Prevent data loss with automated backups for files and unsaved changes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Windows 10 is half baked one IE and now this editor.

I was surprised with the built in extensions, but I'm feeling terrible after experiencing this issue.

I was working with this editor, and suddenly my system became very slow and I'm forced to shut down my system. After the restart my current working file (see the attachment), got changed in to some other encoding. I lost my 3 hours of work :(.
- Bala
  [global.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/57803/global.txt)
